text: that's a velvet worm you can see what
happens when you poke it it squirts
slime all over to catch prey fend off
predators and poking fingers a Chilean
scientist studying at Harvard wondered
whether the animal had a complicated way
of controlling its slime spray he
started by looking at videos of the
animals made in the wild
then he collected some specimens to
study in the lab turns out the velvet
worms squirt control system is really
simple it has a big slime reservoir and
flexible spouts called papillae as it
squeezes the reservoir the slime comes
out faster until it makes the papillae
wave around like a loose garden hose the
researchers made an artificial version
but they need to miniaturize it more
there's a whole world of microscopic
manufacturing that could use such a
simple effective spraying system
